etymology.description: 宀(宀) (mián, 'roof') + 也(也) (yě, 'also') -> 宀 suggests a meaning related to 'under a roof', while 也 provides the phonetic element -> 'it', a general pronoun
etymology.interpretation: The character 它(tā, 'it') combines 宀(宀) (mián, 'roof') as a semantic element indicating something within a defined space or category, while 也(也) (yě, 'also') suggests phonetics. It was originally used to refer to a snake or serpent in ancient Chinese but evolved in modern usage to refer to inanimate objects or abstract entities.

examples.chinese: 它在花园里奔跑(它在花園裡奔跑)。
examples.english: It is running in the garden.

examples.chinese: 电视坏了(電視壞了)，它不能运作(它不能運作)。
examples.pinyin: Diànshì huài le, tā bùnéng yùnzuò.
examples.english: The television is broken, it cannot operate.
